N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 53.7 - Test reports and certification

State Regulations
(a) Test reports submitted to the
commissioner for the purpose of securing approval of a formulation must consist
of the results of tests made on five samples and must contain the
classification of the formulation as specified in section
53.4. Such report must contain a
certification as to the accuracy of the report and that the materials tested
comply with the requirements of this Part. Such certification must be made by
an independent testing agency, approved by the commissioner, which either
physically conducted or observed at least two of the tests and testing
equipment even though such tests were physically conducted by the manufacturer, employees of the manufacturer or other persons. (b) Prior to January 1, 1967, test reports
submitted to the commissioner for the purpose of securing interim approval of a
formulation may be certified by a manufacturer who conducts the tests, provided
such tests were conducted after July 1, 1965. (c) If interim approval of a formulation has
been obtained pursuant to the procedure specified in subdivision (b) of this
section, permanent certification may be obtained by submitting two additional
test reports certified by an independent testing agency, approved by the
commissioner, which either physically conducted or observed the two tests and
testing equipment. Such tests shall be used in conjunction with the five tests
previously submitted, and the results of the seven tests must meet the
requirements of subdivisions (a) and (b) of section
53.5
before permanent approval
will be issued. Notes
